meanings.definition: A sudden loud noise or explosion.
meanings.sent1: The blaff of the fireworks startled the dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a blaff coming from the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The blaff of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The blaff of thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The blaff of the car backfiring echoed through the street.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden loud noise or explosion.
meanings.sent1: He likes to blaff his toy gun during playtime.
meanings.sent2: The firecracker will blaff when lit.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally made the microwave blaff by overheating her popcorn.
meanings.sent4: The engine started to blaff loudly, signaling a problem.
meanings.sent5: The kids love to blaff their party poppers at celebrations.

meanings.sent1: His blaff about her cooking upset her.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't forget the blaff he made about her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The blaff about his outfit made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her blaff stung more than she expected.
meanings.sent5: The blaff about his singing was meant as a joke.

meanings.sent1: He tends to blaff when he's angry.
meanings.sent2: The coach began to blaff instructions to the team.
meanings.sent3: She didn't mean to blaff at her friend; it was just frustration.
meanings.sent4: The politician continued to blaff about his opponent.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to blaff to be heard over the noisy classroom.
